nodes.bodyText: Homepage isn't always the landing page after login. For example, a user could have entered workspace url directly.
It is not enabled in staging workflow because the automation script that delete workspaces and billing projects are not working in staging.

nodes.bodyText: Reminder to myself: Remove this call in workflow before merge to master branch.
what do these changes have to do with running the tests in staging?

The original way of finding select option is relying on the value. however, values are different for the Dataset on test and staging. see screenshots below. I had to change it to use displayed texts instead of value.
test env.

staging env.
What do these changes have to do with running tests in staging?
result of changes in Select class.

In staging, there is a enabled UI feature flag which is disabled in test.
UI behaviors are different as result. I had to modify this test so it works in both env.
what flag is it? is it possible to condition the behavior of this test on the feature flag? how come these changes work on both staging and test?

I believe it was enableCBAgeTypeOptions. But I did a quick search now, flag was removed 3 days ago for all env. So I don't know what happens next.
What the feature flag did wass: the count on the age slider is pre-calculated and then the real count is calculated in bigquery when Finish button in Modal is clicked. Pre-calcuated count is different from calculated count.
would expect(totalCount).toEqual(group1Count) not then fail with the feature flag enabled?

No, test shouldn't fail with or without flag.
Old way was to get the count within Age modal then verify count after close Age modal. New way is get the calculated Group Count after close Age modal, and then compare it with the Total Count. Because only one group, Group Count and Total Count should match.

Changes here also for running test consistently in both env. In test env, all existing workspaces were created using Synthetic Dataset 3. In staging env, most of existing workspaces were created on Synthetic Dataset 1. Reusing Synthetic Dataset 1 workspaces are causing problems. So the solution is modify the test code - create new workspaces.
unrelated change. while running and inspecting test code, I realized 3 lines of code can be rewritten in one line.
Avoid finding and using Synthetic Dataset 1 workspaces.

nodes.bodyText:
Would prefer a consistent naming convention for these, e.g.
PUPPETEER_USER_STAGING
PUPPETEER_USER_TEST
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -205,12 +205,25 @@ commands:
 
   run_e2e_test:
     description: "Run puppeteer e2e integration tests"
+    parameters:
+      env_name:
+        description: The target environment for run Puppeteer tests. Must be one of "dev", "staging".
+        default: "dev"
+        type: enum
+        enum: ["dev", "staging"]
     steps:
       - install_e2e_dependencies
       - run:
-          name: Update Puppeteer test environment variables
+          name: Update test user email env variable
+          command: |
+            case << parameters.env_name >> in
+              staging) echo 'export USER_NAME=$PUPPETEER_TEST_USER_STAGING' >> $BASH_ENV ;;
+              dev) echo 'export USER_NAME=$PUPPETEER_TEST_USER' >> $BASH_ENV ;;

       - manage_api_cache:
           save: true
 
-  # Run Puppeteer e2e UI tests on deployed "test" environment.

   puppeteer-e2e-test:

+      env_name:
+        description: The target environment for run Puppeteer tests. Must be one of "dev", "staging".
+        default: "dev"

+        enum: ["dev", "staging"]
